user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl:
```c
void OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl(uint32 ModeBits)
{
    char param[32];

    if (OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.EnableTermControl)
    {
        if (ModeBits == OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL)
        {
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("sgr0", NULL);
        }
        else
        {
            if ((ModeBits & OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT) == 0)
            {
                /* no highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("rmso", NULL);
            }
            else
            {
                /* set highlight (standout) text */
                OS_BSP_ExecTput("smso", NULL);
            }

            snprintf(param, sizeof(param), "%d", OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_TO_ANSICOLOR(ModeBits));
            OS_BSP_ExecTput("setaf", param);
        }
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl:
OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobalData_t OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal
...
#define OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL 0x0
...
#define OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT 0x8
...
#define OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_TO_ANSICOLOR(x) ((x)&0x07)
...
void UT_BSP_DoText(uint8 MessageType, const char *OutputMessage)
{
    char   Buffer[16];
    size_t MsgLen;
    uint32 TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL;
    uint32 MsgEnabled   = BSP_UT_Global.CurrVerbosity >> MessageType;

    if (MsgEnabled & 1)
    {
        UT_BSP_Lock();

        /* Determine if the message type warrants special treatment (color/highlight/etc). */
        switch (MessageType)
        {
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_ABORT:
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_FAILURE:
                TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_RED;
                break;
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_MIR:
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_WARN:
                TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_RED | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_GREEN;
                break;
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_TSF:
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_TTF:
                TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_RED | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_BLUE;
                break;
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_BEGIN:
                OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl("\n", 1); /* add a bit of extra whitespace between tests */
                break;
            case UTASSERT_CASETYPE_PASS:
                TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT | OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_GREEN;
                break;
            default:
                break;
        }

        if (MsgEnabled <= 1)
        {
            TermModeBits = OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL;
        }

        snprintf(Buffer, sizeof(Buffer), "[%5s]", UtAssert_GetCaseTypeAbbrev(MessageType));

        if (TermModeBits != OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL)
        {
            OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl(TermModeBits);
        }

        OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl(Buffer, strlen(Buffer));

        if (TermModeBits != OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL)
        {
            OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl(OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL);
        }

        OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl(" ", 1);
        MsgLen = strlen(OutputMessage);
        OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl(OutputMessage, MsgLen);
        if (MsgLen == 0 || OutputMessage[MsgLen - 1] != '\n')
        {
            OS_BSP_ConsoleOutput_Impl("\n", 1);
        }

        UT_BSP_Unlock();
    }

    /*
     * If any ABORT (major failure) message is thrown,
     * then call a BSP-provided routine to stop the test and possibly dump a core
     */
    if (MessageType == UTASSERT_CASETYPE_ABORT)
    {
        OS_BSP_Shutdown_Impl();
    }
}
...
static void OS_BSP_ExecTput(const char *cap, const char *param)
{
    pid_t cpid;
    int   status;

    cpid = fork();
    if (cpid < 0)
    {
        return;
    }
    if (cpid == 0)
    {
        execlp("tput", "tput", cap, param, NULL);
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
    waitpid(cpid, &status, 0);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I examined OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl and the related code fragments. I found no code that is provably unreachable under all possible runtime conditions:

- The outer if (OS_BSP_GenericLinuxGlobal.EnableTermControl) can be true or false at runtime; both the taken and not-taken paths are reachable depending on the global flag. No code inside that block is intrinsically unreachable.
- The ModeBits == OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL branch and the else branch are both reachable because ModeBits is a runtime parameter (set to NORMAL in many call sites but also set to non-zero values in UT_BSP_DoText). Within the else, both the ((ModeBits & OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_HIGHLIGHT) == 0) and the else branch are reachable depending on the highlight bit in ModeBits.
- The snprintf + OS_BSP_ExecTput("setaf", param) sequence is reachable whenever ModeBits != OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_NORMAL; OS_BSP_CONSOLEMODE_TO_ANSICOLOR uses a mask and does not make the call unreachable.
- In UT_BSP_DoText, every switch case can be reached depending on MessageType; the later checks (if (MsgEnabled <= 1) and the TermModeBits != NORMAL checks) depend on runtime values and are not statically unreachable.
- In OS_BSP_ExecTput, the fork error path (cpid < 0), the child path (cpid == 0) and the parent waitpid path (cpid > 0) are all reachable at runtime. The exit(EXIT_FAILURE) after execlp is reachable if execlp fails (execlp replaces the process image on success). Passing param as NULL to execlp merely shortens the argument list and does not make subsequent code unreachable.

Because none of the statements are provably unreachable given the available definitions and runtime-dependent inputs, there are no suspicious fragments to flag for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 investigation.
